document.docTitle: Penia mantillerii Kundrata & Németh 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Description of Penia mantillerii sp. nov. (Coleoptera: Elateridae: Dimini), with a key to Penia species from Vietnam and nearby areas

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of Penia mantillerii sp. nov. (Coleoptera: Elateridae: Dimini), with a key to Penia species from Vietnam and nearby areas

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material .
Holotype , male, „ VIETNAM , Lao Cai Prov. , Hoang Lien NP, Tram Ton ,
1915 m
, 22.3493723°N , 103.7704565°E // forest edge, at light,
8.–11.IV.2010
, leg. L. Papp , L. Peregovits & Z. Soltész , VN2010 PL _4“ ( HNHM ).

Type locality
. Vietnam : Lào Cai Province , Hoang Lien NP , Tram Ton Pass ( 22.3493723°N , 103.7704565°E )
.

The brown and elongate body of this species resembles
P. costipennis Fleutiaux, 1936
and
P. sucinea Schimmel, 2001
( Figs 17, 18 ), both occuring also in Lŕo Cai Province in northern Vietnam .
Penia costipennis
differs from
P. mantillerii
sp. nov.
in having antennomere IV about 2.5 times longer than antennomere III, the pronotal posterior angles oriented posteriorly, and the elytral interstria VI forming more distinct carina ( Fig. 17 ).
Penia sucinea
is larger, with more elongate elytra, antennomere IV 2.7 times longer than antennomere III, scutellar shield about as long as wide, with more rounded sides, much smaller elytral punctures, and differently shaped male sternite IX and aedeagus ( Figs 18, 20, 22, 23, 27–30 ).
Description . Holotype , male. Body elongate ( Figs 1–3 ) 7.4 mm long, 2.5 mm wide, moderately convex in lateral view, uniformly brown; pubescence yellow-brown to pale-brown.
Etymology. The species name is a patronym in honor of Antoine Mantilleri (MNHN, Paris).
